intro: Trichosalpinx membraniflora, commonly known as the membranous-flowered trichosalpinx, is a member of the Bignoniaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The flowers are showy, with a distinctive tubular shape and vibrant colors, typically yellow or orange. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. The plant's botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
